trans-unit.source: This section covers the general setup done in the cc|alloy management module as well as the setup required on the master data (items, customers and vendors).

seg-source.mrk: This section covers the general setup done in the cc|alloy management module as well as the setup required on the master data (items, customers and vendors).

trans-unit.source: All cc|alloy management setup pages are accessed from the cc|project menu by clicking Construction > Alloy Surcharges.

seg-source.mrk: All cc|alloy management setup pages are accessed from the cc|project menu by clicking Construction > Alloy Surcharges.

trans-unit.source: The general setup for cc|alloy management is done in the Alloy Surcharges Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: The general setup for cc|alloy management is done in the Alloy Surcharges Setup page.

trans-unit.source: The fields in the Alloy Surcharges Setup page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Alloy Surcharges Setup page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the base calendar that is used for calculating the base date for the alloy quotation.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the base calendar that is used for calculating the base date for the alloy quotation.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the defaults alloy condition code that will be used if no vendor or customer-specific code is found; refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Alloy" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Alloy Conditions” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the defaults alloy condition code that will be used if no vendor or customer-specific code is found; refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Alloy" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Alloy Conditions” on page 1</MadCap:xref>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the default website that will open when the “Quotations (WWW)” function is used in the Alloy Quotations page (refer to section “Alloy Quotations” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the default website that will open when the “Quotations (WWW)” function is used in the Alloy Quotations page (refer to section “Alloy Quotations” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: In the Alloy Types page, the different types of alloy that are used in quotations are defined.

seg-source.mrk: In the Alloy Types page, the different types of alloy that are used in quotations are defined.

trans-unit.source: The fields in the Alloy Types page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Alloy Types page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the alloy; typically the same as used in the standard Periodic Table.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier of the alloy; typically the same as used in the standard Periodic Table.

trans-unit.source: Short description of the alloy; typically the same as used in the standard Periodic Table.

seg-source.mrk: Short description of the alloy; typically the same as used in the standard Periodic Table.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the item charge that will be used when the alloy is added to the sales or purchase line.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the item charge that will be used when the alloy is added to the sales or purchase line.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the unit of measure that is used when selling/purchasing the alloy.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the unit of measure that is used when selling/purchasing the alloy.

trans-unit.source: Alloy Conditions are used to define rules for establishing the alloy quotation.

seg-source.mrk: Alloy Conditions are used to define rules for establishing the alloy quotation.

trans-unit.source: The fields in the Alloy Conditions page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Alloy Conditions page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier for the alloy condition.

seg-source.mrk: Unique identifier for the alloy condition.

trans-unit.source: Short description of the alloy condition.

seg-source.mrk: Short description of the alloy condition.

trans-unit.source: Determines which base is defined to be used. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Determines which base is defined to be used.

trans-unit.source: Used with the Calculation Formula field to determine period ranges.

seg-source.mrk: Used with the Calculation Formula field to determine period ranges.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the formula for calculating the period range; used with the value in the Period field. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the formula for calculating the period range; used with the value in the Period field.

trans-unit.source: Determines which document date is the base for establishing the alloy quotation. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Determines which document date is the base for establishing the alloy quotation.

trans-unit.source: If selected, the alloy quotation is established considering one month earlier than calculated. This option is only used with the Calculation Formula of Month, Quarter, Half-Year and Year.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the alloy quotation is established considering one month earlier than calculated.
This option is only used with the Calculation Formula of Month, Quarter, Half-Year and Year.

trans-unit.source: In the Alloy Quotations page, the quotation values per period, per 100kg, for each alloy type is specified. On the General FastTab, enter the Alloy Type code and then enter the quotation information in the lines.

seg-source.mrk: In the Alloy Quotations page, the quotation values per period, per 100kg, for each alloy type is specified.
On the General FastTab, enter the Alloy Type code and then enter the quotation information in the lines.

trans-unit.source: : Alloy Quotations with data for Copper

seg-source.mrk: : Alloy Quotations with data for Copper

trans-unit.source: The fields in the lines of the Alloy Quotations page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the lines of the Alloy Quotations page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the date on which the quotation is valid.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the date on which the quotation is valid.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the lower value for the quotation on this date.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the lower value for the quotation on this date.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the upper value for the quotation on this date.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the upper value for the quotation on this date.

trans-unit.source: Automatically calculated based on the values in the Lower Quotation and Upper Quotation fields.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically calculated based on the values in the Lower Quotation and Upper Quotation fields.

trans-unit.source: The “Quotations (WWW)” function on the ribbon opens the website indicated in the Quotations Web Url field in the Alloy Management Setup page, and can be used to gather the lower and upper quotation values based on the period.

seg-source.mrk: The “Quotations (WWW)” function on the ribbon opens the website indicated in the Quotations Web Url field in the Alloy Management Setup page, and can be used to gather the lower and upper quotation values based on the period.

trans-unit.source: Once the setup is complete in cc|alloy management, Alloy Weight needs to be assigned to items and Alloy Conditions need to be set up on customers and vendors. This setup is described in this section.

seg-source.mrk: Once the setup is complete in cc|alloy management, Alloy Weight needs to be assigned to items and Alloy Conditions need to be set up on customers and vendors.
This setup is described in this section.

trans-unit.source: On the Actions tab of the Item Card, click Alloy Weights to open the Item Alloy Weights page, where weight quantity and unit of measure is defined for an item.

seg-source.mrk: On the Actions tab of the Item Card, click Alloy Weights to open the Item Alloy Weights page, where weight quantity and unit of measure is defined for an item.

trans-unit.source: : Item Alloy Weights for copper set up on Item Card

seg-source.mrk: : Item Alloy Weights for copper set up on Item Card

trans-unit.source: The fields in the Item Alloy Weights page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Item Alloy Weights page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the alloy type for which weights are defined for this item.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the alloy type for which weights are defined for this item.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the weight contained in the item per base unit of measure relating to the Alloy Weight Quantity field.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the weight contained in the item per base unit of measure relating to the Alloy Weight Quantity field.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the quantity per base unit of measure relating to the Alloy Weight field.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the quantity per base unit of measure relating to the Alloy Weight field.

trans-unit.source: Automatically calculated based on the values of the Alloy Weight and Alloy Weight Quantity fields.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically calculated based on the values of the Alloy Weight and Alloy Weight Quantity fields.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the base price that will be used in the quotations.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the base price that will be used in the quotations.

trans-unit.source: On the Navigate tab of the Customer Card, click Alloy Conditions to open the Cust./Vend. - Alloy Conditions page, where the billing condition is defined for a customer.

seg-source.mrk: On the Navigate tab of the Customer Card, click Alloy Conditions to open the Cust./Vend.
- Alloy Conditions page, where the billing condition is defined for a customer.

trans-unit.source: : Alloy Conditions for copper on the Customer Card

seg-source.mrk: : Alloy Conditions for copper on the Customer Card

trans-unit.source: The fields in the Cust./Vend. - Alloy Conditions page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: - Alloy Conditions page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the alloy type for which the conditions are defined for this customer.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the alloy type for which the conditions are defined for this customer.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the condition for the alloy type for this customer.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the condition for the alloy type for this customer.

trans-unit.source: Automatically populated from the Alloy Condition Code value.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically populated from the Alloy Condition Code value.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the base price that will be used in the quotations for this customer.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the base price that will be used in the quotations for this customer.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether amount scales exist for this alloy condition or not.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether amount scales exist for this alloy condition or not.

trans-unit.source: Click the value in the field to open the Alloy Surcharges Amount Scales page where a minimum amount and surcharge percentage can be defined for the condition.

seg-source.mrk: Click the value in the field to open the Alloy Surcharges Amount Scales page where a minimum amount and surcharge percentage can be defined for the condition.

trans-unit.source: Indicates a special quotation price that has been agreed to with this customer.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates a special quotation price that has been agreed to with this customer.

trans-unit.source: Alloy Conditions for Vendors are set up the same as on Customers. On the Navigate tab of the Vendor Card, click Alloy Conditions to open the Cust./Vend. - Alloy Conditions page, where the billing condition is defined for a vendor.

seg-source.mrk: Alloy Conditions for Vendors are set up the same as on Customers.
On the Navigate tab of the Vendor Card, click Alloy Conditions to open the Cust./Vend.
- Alloy Conditions page, where the billing condition is defined for a vendor.

trans-unit.source: : Alloy Conditions for copper on the Vendor Card

seg-source.mrk: : Alloy Conditions for copper on the Vendor Card

trans-unit.source: Refer to section “Customers” on page 1 for details about the fields on the Cust.-/Vend. - Alloy Conditions page.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Customer" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Customers” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for details about the fields on the <span class="Bold">Cust.-/Vend.
